speaker: Nicholas Hartley
text: This episode was much better than I thought it would be.  It turned out a real splendour with some great gags.  It even had a small Niles and Daphne storyline.  There were many wonderful parts of this including the tree in the bathroom bit.  Absolutely hilarious. My criticisms are the obvious lack of Roz but she had her week last week. **A-**   * * *  ## AWARDS & NOMINATIONS  ## Won  EMMY
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series
text: Jay Kogen  WRITERS GUILD OF AMERICA

speaker: Episodic Comedy (TV)
text: Jay Kogen  ## Nominated  DIRECTORS GUILD OF AMERICA
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Comedy Series
text: Kelsey Grammer  * * *  ## Transcript {nick hartley}     _Act One.  Scene One - Department Store. Roz and Frasier are walking through the store.  Frasier is carrying a bag with a Menorah in it for Frederick._

speaker: Roz
text: I thought your father was in charge of Christmas decorations.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, not this year.  We're doing it my way.  That's why I'm ordering a tasteful tree here.  They'll even deliver it on Christmas Eve, fully decorated.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sarcastic_] Gee, that'll be fun for Freddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, Frederick won't be joining me this year.  He's spending his vacation on an archaeological tour with Lilith.

speaker: Roz
text: He's spending Christmas with dried-up old bones?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] I thought I told you, she's taking him on an archaeological tour. [_laughs with Roz_] Oh good lord, look how late it's gotten!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, don't blame me, you're the one who spent twenty minutes looking for that candleholder thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, it's a Menorah, Roz.  I thought I'd get one for Frederick for Hanukah.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that's right, I completely forgot Frederick is half-Jewish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, between the Crane boy genes and Lilith's contribution, I'm not sure the NFL is holding its breath.

speaker: Roz
text: I need to go over to "Notions" and try to find something for Calvin, the security guard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what are you getting him?

speaker: Roz
text: If I knew I wouldn't be going to "Notions."  _Roz leaves to the "Notions" part of the store.  Frasier goes to the clothes department and asks the assistant (Sal):_

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, I'd like to get a gift for that woman I was with. Er, how about this sweater right here?

speaker: Sal
text: Excellent choice.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not sure of the size, though, could you find me this in a medium?  Thank you.

speaker: Roz
text: It's a madhouse in there!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: People pushing and shoving for nose-hair clippers.  Is there a nasal hair epidemic I don't know about?

speaker: Sal
text: [_rising_] Here's your sweater.

speaker: Roz
text: Is he talking to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering_] No!  No, no, he's talking...  _A woman, of about fifty, in a red dress - Mrs. Helen Moskowitz - comes to his rescue._

speaker: Helen
text: He's talking to me!  It's for my niece.  But I'm a bit worried about the size. [_to Roz_] You know, she's just about your height.  Do you mind my asking, would this fit you?

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm, that's a little big for me.

speaker: Helen
text: What about the color?  A little blah?

speaker: Roz
text: Personally, I like the blue.

speaker: Helen
text: I agree, thank you so much. [_to Sal_] I will take a smaller size in the blue, and please gift-wrap it.

speaker: Sal
text: Coming right up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, it looks like "Notions" has thinned out.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh good, so you think Calvin will like the nose hair clippers?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think we can be sure he doesn't own a pair!

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, thank you so much for bailing me out that way.

speaker: Helen
text: My pleasure. [_shakes his hand_] Helen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Helen, Frasier.

speaker: Helen
text: Not Frasier Crane, from the radio show?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Helen
text: Oh, ha-ho, I listen to you every time I come to Seattle to visit my daughter, Faye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's very kind.

speaker: Helen
text: You know, you really should know your wife's size.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, she's not my wife.

speaker: Helen
text: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to pry.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right.

speaker: Helen
text: Girlfriend?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I don't have a girlfriend, actually.  I'm unattached.

speaker: Helen
text: Oh.  Well, I've taken enough of your time.  Although, there is one small thing you could help me with.  I'm looking for something for my daughter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what is it?

speaker: Helen
text: Nah, no, I really shouldn't ask.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, please.

speaker: Helen
text: No, no, it's too much of an imposition.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  After the way you came to my rescue, I would be delighted to help you in any way I can.  What is it you're looking to get for your daughter?

speaker: Helen
text: A date with a nice, unattached doctor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I certainly walked into that one, didn't I?

speaker: Helen
text: It wasn't my first time! _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier and Niles are standing in the Cafe as Frasier waits for his date._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, now as soon as this woman gets here give me five minutes and then call me on my cell phone.  If I am miserable I will simply say it's an emergency and excuse myself.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, yes, the ever-valuable escape call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you've done them?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... [_laughs as if he's remembering the time, then stops_] No, but I've seen them done. _Niles takes a position at the window seat as Faye - a beautiful woman with waves of black hair and an intelligent, forthright manner - enters._  [_N.B. For my money, Amy Brenneman is the most attractive woman Frasier has dated before or since in the whole series - Mike Lee :-)_]

speaker: Faye
text: Excuse me, are you Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_delighted_] Faye? [_she nods_] Yes, hello! [_rises and shakes her hand_] How did you know it was me?

speaker: Faye
text: You had that horror-stricken look of someone who's met my mother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, [_points to seat_] please, please, shall we?

speaker: Faye
text: Oh, no, that's very sweet of you but you don't have to go through with this.  I really just came to apologize.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, please, please, why don't you sit down?

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Dr. Crane.  Are you here with your brother?

speaker: Niles
text: [_points to Frasier_] No, actually he's on a blind date.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he is, isn't he!  _She sits with him.  Niles begins to act nervous around Daphne. He begins fidgeting._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, look at him.  I think he really fancies her.  You know, it's always so obvious when a man likes a woman.

speaker: Daphne
text: You can just tell by his awkward body language.

speaker: Daphne
text: Shifting in his chair, he doesn't know quite what to do with his hands.

speaker: Daphne
text: He's as nervous as a hen. [_shouts_] Oh for God's sake, stop fidgeting! _Niles, thinking she's talking to him, stops moving.  Then he realizes she was talking about Frasier.  Meanwhile, Frasier and Faye..._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, your mother tells me that you're a lawyer.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, that's typical.  I was a lawyer and I quit two years ago, and now I'm a pastry chef.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Faye
text: Yes.  I work in a little French restaurant in town.  Maybe you've heard of it?  Le Cigare Volant.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, it's one of my favorites!  I had dinner there last Friday night.

speaker: Faye
text: I worked there last Friday night, what did you have?

speaker: Frasier
text: The Grand Marquis Souffle.

speaker: Faye
text: I made that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it was poetry on a plate.

speaker: Faye
text: Thank you. [_then_] You didn't happen to find my earring in it, did you? [_Frasier gives her a look_] I'm kidding!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, [_laughs_] you know, suddenly I'm glad that your mother is as pushy as she is.  It's funny, though, you're nothing like her.

speaker: Faye
text: That's the nicest thing anyone's ever said to me. [_laughs_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, can I ask a favor?  What are you doing for the next ten nights, because my...

speaker: Niles
text: [_quickly_] Yes. [_Daphne gives him a look_] Excuse me, finish the question.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, my neighborhood theatre group is putting on a holiday revue; in fact, we're performing in the common room of Dr. Crane's building.

speaker: Niles
text: Right downstairs?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, but we're still looking for a musical director.  I would never ask you but they've put me in charge of the whole thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well count me in.  Is the show more religious in tone or secular?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_gets out her notes_] Well, we couldn't quite agree.  So we ended up with a mixed bag.  Er, we open with the "no room at the inn" scene, then it's a rousing version of "Jingle Bell Rock," a brief medley from "Jesus Christ Superstar."  And the first act ends with Santa's elves and the three wise men all linking arms and singing "Frosty the Snowman."

speaker: Niles
text: Well... [_gropes for a response_] Excuse me, I have to make a phone call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course I love Boston but well, there's no place like home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me. [_into phone_] Yes, hello?  Uh, yes but you know what, I'll just have to sign those papers later, thank you. [_hangs up_] Office work.

speaker: Faye
text: That was an escape call, wasn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  What are you talking about?

speaker: Faye
text: Come on, it's a blind date.  You wanted a way to back out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, you are sharp, aren't you?  How did you know?  _Faye's mobile starts ringing.  She gives a look as we FADE OUT.  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Niles is hanging up a stylish wreath in the apartment.  Frasier is on the phone to Faye._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to phone_] Well, that would be just lovely.  All right, I'll see you soon. [_hangs up_] Well, isn't that nice? Faye's dropping by.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you've been seeing a lot of her lately, haven't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I have.  You know, she really is quite wonderful.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I thought she was off to Florida with her mother.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, she is.  They're both popping by on the way to the airport.  I guess someone wanted to rack up a few more frequent Frasier miles. [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_chucks him on the shoulder, then_] You don't ever actually say those things to the woman, do you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh good, Dr. Crane, you're here.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, the show starts in half an hour.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, could you give me a hand?  I still have to sew the chains to Jacob Marley's tux for the dance number.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yeah, happy to.

speaker: Frasier
text: Jacob Marley?  They're doing "A Christmas Carol" too?

speaker: Niles
text: No, they're not.  They worked him into the nativity scene. _Niles exits after Daphne.  Martin then enters from his room with "Rudolph" - a big garish wreath with Rudolph popping out of it. His nose looks as if it can glow if plugged in._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Fras', where's a good spot for Rudolph this year?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  Please, I thought we had an agreement about the decorations.

speaker: Martin
text: I know, but what's Christmas without Rudolph?

speaker: Frasier
text: He is not even one of the original reindeer!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, do the others have a song?

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I'm not having this discussion again!

speaker: Martin
text: It's because you know I'm right.  Well, forget it, I wouldn't want to ruin your designer Christmas! _Martin exits to his room as the doorbell sounds.  Frasier answers it to Faye._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Faye. [_hugs her_] Hi, good to see you.  Here, let me take your coat. [_does_] Where's Helen?

speaker: Faye
text: Er, she's talking to your doorman.  She's trying to fix him up with my cousin Janet and I couldn't bear to watch.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_re: door_] We'll just leave that ajar for her then.

speaker: Faye
text: Oh my gosh.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Faye
text: You have a wreath.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, so?

speaker: Faye
text: Aren't you Jewish?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, why do you ask?

speaker: Faye
text: The day we met my mother saw you shopping for a Menorah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, for my son.  My ex-wife is Jewish.

speaker: Faye
text: Oh, God...

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there a problem?

speaker: Faye
text: Uh, for me, no, but my mother is another story, and here I was wondering what we'd talk about on the seven hour flight to Miami.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, I can just take this down.

speaker: Faye
text: Uh, no, no, no, no, I have to stop being a child about these things.  If she's upset, she's upset.

speaker: Frasier
text: How many stopovers do you have?

speaker: Faye
text: Two.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll take it down.

speaker: Faye
text: Thank you.

speaker: Faye
text: I really appreciate you doing this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's no problem.

speaker: Faye
text: I can't believe I'm actually asking you to pretend you to be Jewish on Christmas Eve.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right, really, it probably won't even come up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, there she is!

speaker: Helen
text: Hello, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Helen, hi.

speaker: Helen
text: Oh, what a beautiful apartment you have.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you very much. _Eddie then jumps up onto the sofa.  He is dressed in a Father Christmas outfit.  Helen's back is turned to him.  Faye looks alarmed._

speaker: Frasier
text: GET OUT!

speaker: Helen
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering_] -of that coat already! [_takes it off her_]  _End Of Act One.  Act Two._  **OY TO THE WORLD**  _Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. Helen, Faye and Frasier are sitting in the apartment and discussing._

speaker: Helen
text: So, Frasier, you grew up in Seattle?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as a matter of fact I did.

speaker: Helen
text: [_looks at view_] Such a pretty city.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.

speaker: Helen
text: I guess you were bar mitzvahed here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, yes of course.  What a proud day that was.  I can still remember reading from the Torah before the... the Rabbi... [_struggling_] and the Cantor... and the _Mohel_.

speaker: Helen
text: The _Mohel_?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Faye
text: [_helping him_] The one who did your circumcision?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I just wanted to show him that there were no hard feelings. [_notices Niles entering_] Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello all, you must be Faye. [_shakes hand_]

speaker: Helen
text: [_shakes his hand_] And I'm her mother, Helen Moskowitz.

speaker: Niles
text: And I'm Frasier's brother, Niles. [_notices the wreath is gone_] Oh, what happened to the...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_interrupting_] The Moskowitz family that lived down the hall? They moved!  You know, Niles, why don't you come and help me in the kitchen?  I'm just about to pour everybody a drink.

speaker: Niles
text: What's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Faye's mother thinks that we're Jewish, just play along.

speaker: Niles
text: [_used to the farce scenario_] Okay. [_pause_] Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's important to Faye, Faye is important to me. Do you think you can pull it off?

speaker: Niles
text: No problem. [_checks oven_] Ooh, ham!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  Please.  We've got to find a time to tell Dad about this too.

speaker: Niles
text: You mean Papa.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, Frasier, is that for Helen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: What if she's expecting Jewish wine?

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, I'm afraid I don't have any of that on hand.

speaker: Niles
text: It's all right, it's easy enough.  It's just like regular wine plus a little bit of this...

speaker: Niles
text: Try that.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_he does_] It's dreadful!

speaker: Niles
text: Perfect.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are. [_hands out wine_]

speaker: Helen
text: Thank you. Who has a nice toast?  Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, all right. _L'chaim!  Mazel tov!_  Next year in Jerusalem!

speaker: Frasier
text: Take it down a notch, Tevye.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Fras', you know, since it's the night before...

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, great, would it be a crime for somebody to tell me we had guests here? [_to the women_] Hi, I'm Marty Crane.  I'm Frasier's dad.  Although you'd never guess it from the way I'm treated like a second-class citizen around here. [_sarcastic_] But as long as Frasier's happy, why should my feelings matter?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, why don't you see if you can go help Dad in the kitchen?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh all right, but he'll probably just _kvetch_ at me and frankly I don't need that _tsuris_. [_gives a "how's that?" smile_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  _With his back turned to Faye & Helen, Frasier mouths, "HALF THAT!" Niles exits to the kitchen as Frasier gives the women a wry smile._  [_N.B. Yiddish: "complain" and "agonies."_]

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know how to be Jewish.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, just answer questions with a question.

speaker: Martin
text: Like what?

speaker: Niles
text: What, I have to explain everything?

speaker: Martin
text: Can't you give me an example?

speaker: Niles
text: What, I should give you an example?

speaker: Martin
text: Are you going to help me or not?

speaker: Niles
text: You're saying I'm not being helpful?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, forget it!

speaker: Helen
text: So, Marty, both your sons are doctors.  How'd you work that out?

speaker: Martin
text: I've no idea. [_then_] Do I? _Everyone looks at each other.  Daphne enters with costumes. Helen begins to dial on her mobile._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I just got the phone call every producer dreads.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Someone's dropping out of the show.

speaker: Daphne
text: You don't suppose you could take over one of the roles?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I don't see why not, I know all the songs.

speaker: Daphne
text: Wonderful.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to ladies_] Well, it was nice meeting you both.

speaker: Faye
text: Likewise.  We're leaving too.  Could you send the elevator back up, we'll be right down.

speaker: Niles
text: Happy to.  So, who dropped out?

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Blanchard.

speaker: Niles
text: _Oy!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, it's been great spending some time with the two of you, I wish you could stay longer.

speaker: Helen
text: [_puts mobile down_] Well, actually we can.  I just called the airline.  The plane is delayed an hour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, isn't that good news?

speaker: Helen
text: You know, I hate to be forward but I'd love to taste whatever smells so wonderful in that kitchen.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I would love to give you a taste, except it isn't done yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, more good news! _FADE TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Faye and Frasier are in the kitchen talking about the farce._

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know how much longer we can continue this charade. My God, when Dad started talking about working on his own car I thought we were goners!

speaker: Faye
text: Well, we only have to keep it up for another half an hour... actually I think I have an idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Faye
text: Go out there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  _Frasier exits and the camera resets to the living room. Faye and Martin are waiting._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know what it is with that brisket, it just won't cook through.

speaker: Helen
text: I could take a look.

speaker: Faye
text: [_enters_] No, no, we don't have the time.  I just got off the phone with the airlines, they pushed the flights back up so we really have to get going.

speaker: Helen
text: Oh, really?  Well, all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, I wish you could stay longer, it's just I'd hate to have you late for your plane.  _Frasier opens the door for them to go - however the man from the department store is there with the Christmas tree._

speaker: Deliverer
text: Hello, sir-

speaker: Frasier
text: On the other hand, I can't leave until you've seen the apartment, all right?

speaker: Faye
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's start with the bedroom.  There's plenty of time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, could you see who it is and make sure they come back later?

speaker: Martin
text: Whatever you want, Frasier, as usual. _Frasier, Faye and Helen go to Frasier's room.  Martin answers the door to the deliverer._

speaker: Deliverer
text: Hello sir, and let me wish you a merry...

speaker: Martin
text: Shush, shush, bring that thing back in about an hour.

speaker: Deliverer
text: No way sir, it's Christmas Eve, I've got a full truck downstairs.  So where do you want it?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh Jeez, I don't know.

speaker: Deliverer
text: You know, a lot of people put them in their living room.

speaker: Martin
text: [_opens powder room_] Here, here put it in the bathroom.

speaker: Deliverer
text: The bathroom?

speaker: Martin
text: Just put it in, all right?

speaker: Deliverer
text: Okay, I've done some crazy things... _Martin, the deliverer and the tree are taken into the powder room and they shut the door behind them.  Then the front door opens.  It is Niles dressed in his Jesus costume. Niles has a cold and is searching for his nasal spray.  He goes into the kitchen.  Martin then looks out of the powder room._

speaker: Martin
text: All right, come on, quick.

speaker: Deliverer
text: Okay.  Well, have a, you know-

speaker: Martin
text: Shut up, get out. _Martin pushes him out of the apartment before shutting the powder room door, leaving the tree in there.  Then, the Moskowitzes and Frasier enter._

speaker: Helen
text: That's a beautiful bedroom, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you, thank you very much.

speaker: Helen
text: [_to Faye_] I noticed you were sort of quiet, Faye, almost as though you've been in there before.

speaker: Faye
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh yeah, I have, Ma, but I was drunk and it was dark: I don't remember so much!

speaker: Helen
text: [_to Martin_] You see how she talks to her mother?  _Oy!_ _At that moment Niles dressed as Jesus walks out of the kitchen.  Helen cannot see him as her back is turned, however Faye and Frasier notice him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Jesus!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll tell you what, I just realized you haven't seen the beautiful balcony.  Dad, would you do the honors and I'll check on the brisket? _Martin, Helen and Faye go onto the balcony.  Meanwhile, Frasier meets Niles in the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: What is going on?

speaker: Niles
text: The man who is supposed to do the number from "Jesus Christ Superstar" - he couldn't go on.  He slipped in the shower; the man who could walk on water, but...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, it's dripping with irony!  Niles, what are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the minute I got within ten feet of the hay for the manger scene, my allergies kicked in.  I think I left my nasal spray here somewhere.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am terribly sorry to tell you this, but you've got to get the hell out of here.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't think that kind of language is appropriate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just shut up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you believe it, it's still pink in the middle.  By the time my brisket's done my _kugel_ will be dry as the Sinai. _Niles begins to leave the apartment.  However, on the way out he spots the powder room.  He opens it and finds his nasal spray.  However, when he tries to get out he realizes that the Moskowitzes, Frasier and Martin are coming in from the balcony.  Niles hides back in the powder room._

speaker: Helen
text: It certainly is beautiful, but now I think we're cutting it close.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you know, you're quite right.  We can continue the tour at another time.  Let me walk you to the door.

speaker: Helen
text: Thank you so much, Frasier, you're wonderful.  You know, maybe I should go to the powder room before we go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, allow me. _Frasier opens the powder room door.  Because of this he is behind the door and cannot see the scene he has uncovered.  We see Niles, dressed as Jesus, using his nasal spray in front of the Christmas tree. Talk about incriminating.  Faye, Helen and Martin just stare. Frasier looks over the door, yells and shuts the door._

speaker: Helen
text: What is going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Helen, I am so terribly sorry. _Niles knocks on the powder room door.  Frasier opens it and Niles enters._

speaker: Niles
text: I'll let you all sort this out, I really have to go.

speaker: Helen
text: I understand, this is your busy time.

speaker: Faye
text: Ma, Frasier's not Jewish.  I told them to pretend so you wouldn't freak out.

speaker: Helen
text: What?  Well, I... you think I care, you can date anyone you want!

speaker: Faye
text: Since when?

speaker: Helen
text: I can't believe you're embarrassing me like this.

speaker: Faye
text: You embarrass me on an hourly basis!

speaker: Helen
text: I embarrass you?! [_to Frasier_] Are you hearing this?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, maybe we should just give you your privacy...

speaker: Helen
text: No one leaves! [_to Faye_] You see, you are making them uncomfortable in their own home.  You could have trusted me to understand.  All I want is for you to be happy.

speaker: Faye
text: As long as I'm happy in the life that you pick out for me!

speaker: Helen
text: Excuse me for being a terrible mother, all I do is care!

speaker: Faye
text: Oh, here it comes, the guilt!  Just because I don't want you controlling my whole life...

speaker: Helen
text: So what do you want me to do about it, cut myself out of it?! You hate me?!

speaker: Faye
text: Sometimes I DO hate you!  _Faye gasps and covers her mouth, realizing what she has said. Helen does the same.  They begin crying._

speaker: Faye
text: I'm sorry Ma, I shouldn't have said that.

speaker: Helen
text: Why not?  I am too involved.  It's because you're all I have.

speaker: Faye
text: But you can't keep running my life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe we should just...

speaker: Helen
text: Sit!  We're nearly done.

speaker: Helen
text: I have been smothering you.  Maybe it's time I learned to let you go.

speaker: Faye
text: I don't want to be let go.  I want you in my life - just not running it.  I do love you, mom.

speaker: Helen
text: Oh, baby, I love you too.

speaker: Faye
text: Well, we should go.

speaker: Helen
text: Right.

speaker: Helen
text: Oh, thank you for a lovely visit.  Enjoy your holiday.

speaker: Faye
text: I am so sorry about all this.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's all right, that's all right. [_hugs her_] Call me when you get back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good night. [_closes door_]

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, that was something.

speaker: Frasier
text: It certainly was.  You know, we've had a couple of squabbles today, but nothing like that.

speaker: Martin
text: No way! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe I should get that Christmas tree out of the bathroom.

speaker: Martin
text: One minute they're talking about one little problem; then suddenly it's everything else.  Then it gets all emotional and messy and then they're hugging and then it's all over.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I suppose that's the healthiest way to go about it, huh, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah, I guess you can't keep that stuff bottled up.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, if you sit on it, you'll just get madder and madder.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, best thing is to just lay it on the line!

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, I want my Rudolph out for Christmas.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, this again?

speaker: Martin
text: It's just not Christmas without it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, we had an agreement about the Christmas decorations this year.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but your Christmas stinks.  I mean, do you call that a tree?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, would it kill you to have a tasteful Christmas just once in your life?  Every year we do Christmas your way.

speaker: Martin
text: And you have things your way every damn day!  I mean look at it, there's nothing of mine around this place except for my chair and you've taken pot shots at that right from the start because it doesn't fit in with your frou-frou knick- knacks!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh that's right, Dad, go ahead, ridicule everything I do: the way I eat, the way I decorate.  Do you have any idea how that makes me feel?

speaker: Martin
text: Do you know how it makes me feel to live like a guest in my own home?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I do everything I can to make you feel welcome in this house, but nothing I ever do is good enough!

speaker: Martin
text: A strange way of making me feel welcome: taking Christmas away from me - the one time of the year when I get to do things my way!  Like it used to be in our home, with your mother and when you were kids!  You know, that's a nice memory for me, you'd think as a psychiatrist you'd figure that out!

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, I'm not even a good psychiatrist!  I guess I'm just a big fat let-down, aren't I?!

speaker: Martin
text: And I'm just a burden to you, AND I HATE LIVING HERE!

speaker: Frasier
text: AND I HATE YOU LIVING HERE! _Similar to Faye and Helen, Martin and Frasier realize what they said. They begin crying._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Jeez.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, I feel terrible.

speaker: Martin
text: So do I.  They were hugging by now!

speaker: Frasier
text: We never should have tried this, we're not Jewish.

speaker: Martin
text: Maybe Mrs. Shapiro next door can talk us through it?

speaker: Frasier
text: She's out of town.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no. [_cries_] I'm sorry, I never should have said what I said.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Dad, no, I should have been more sensitive.  I am a psychiatrist.

speaker: Martin
text: And you're a damned good one too, and I'm very proud of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Dad, I didn't mean any of the things I said.  I love having you here.

speaker: Martin
text: I love being here.  I always have.

speaker: Frasier
text: Honestly?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, no, but I thought it would get us to the hug!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, let's try.
